page.title: 13 Social Concerns
page.content: {Romanies { }Our area has verges 6,8,10 metres wide,these make excellent stopping places for travellingfolk.We often have true Romanies(whose ancesters orginated in the Himalayas in India) passing through.They are often travelling to or from a horse sale at Stow on the Wold.They are a shy, retiring people but we were able to talk to the husband of the family as he boiled water over a wood fire. His caravans were wooden with tarpaulin covers and wooden wheels apart from the permeter which had a covering of rubber.A daughter had painted all the wood with intricate pattern.The gipsy man used a catapult for shooting rabbits and pheasants for food.Peg making time was near,the willow was nearly ready but we saw as they left on there two month journey.
